content:
So @oli and I want to make a stream to discuss this RPITIT refactoring we are doing with @Santiago Pastorino and @cjgillot. We were debating what to call it.

I was wondering if it would be nice to have a category for streams like this -- i.e., particular projects that are being worked on.

They could almost be topics, but you can't subscribe to topics -- plus, often those projects have sub-topics, so I think a stream works well.

I am thinking topic/rpitit-refactor as a possible name, for example.
or project/rpitit-refactor, but project is overloaded
effort/rpitit-refactor
one-off/rpitit-refactor
etc/rpitit-refactor :)
I kind of like etc
thoughts?
ohh I like this idea a lot, the only drawback I may think of is if this may end polluting too much the streams list
tbh, the stream list is already unmanageable for me, I just gave up and search
maybe once the project is done, we can move all the topics to #t-compiler or wherever the project belongs
maybe we need to ask zulip folks whether making the stream list a tree view seems reasonable to them?
this may also be a good idea :)
@Santiago Pastorino I would like to have a stream for the negative work too
I'd like to move our conversation off from privmsg :)
I'm trying to be more aggressive about pinning streams I actually should keep up with

nikomatsakis said:

I'd like to move our conversation off from privmsg :)

:+1:
let's do that too
Are you looking for a stream or a topic within a stream?
If it needs multiple topics, misc/xyz makes sense, possibly with a date in the name.
But also, misc itself might work for long-running topics that stay within one topic, which if you were previously using PMs might be fine.
